title: FizzBuzz
description: Write a function that prints the numbers from 1 to n. For multiples of three print 'Fizz' instead of the number. For multiples of five print 'Buzz'. For numbers which are multiples of both three and five print 'FizzBuzz'.
instructions: Implement the `fizzbuzz(n)` function that returns a list of strings representing the FizzBuzz sequence from 1 to n.

testCases.expectedOutput:
1
2
Fizz
4
Buzz
Fizz
7
8
Fizz
Buzz
11
Fizz
13
14
FizzBuzz

correctness.description: Code produces correct output for all test cases

codeQuality.description: Code is clean, readable, and follows Python conventions

efficiency.description: Solution is efficient with O(n) time complexity

edgeCases.description: Handles edge cases like n=0, n=1 properly

title: Two Sum
description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.
instructions: Implement the `two_sum(nums, target)` function that returns a list of two indices.
starterCode:
def two_sum(nums, target):
    # Your code here
    pass

# Test your function
if __name__ == '__main__':
    import json
    data = input()
    parsed = json.loads(data)
    nums = parsed['nums']
    target = parsed['target']
    result = two_sum(nums, target)
    print(json.dumps(result))

correctness.description: Returns correct indices for all test cases

title: Valid Palindrome
description: A phrase is a palindrome if, after converting all uppercase letters into lowercase letters and removing all non-alphanumeric characters, it reads the same forward and backward.
instructions: Implement the `is_palindrome(s)` function that returns True if the string is a palindrome, False otherwise.
starterCode:
def is_palindrome(s):
    # Your code here
    pass

# Test your function
if __name__ == '__main__':
    s = input()
    result = is_palindrome(s)
    print(str(result))

testCases.input: A man, a plan, a canal: Panama

title: Factorial

instructions: Implement the `factorial(n)` function that returns the factorial of n.
